Uses of Interface
networking.NetworkSerializable

    • Uses of NetworkSerializable in networking

      Classes in networking that implement NetworkSerializable 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      (package private) class  DisconnectClientPacket
      The DisconnectClientPacket class is a special packet type that is used internally to disconnect clients from the server.
      Methods in networking with type parameters of type NetworkSerializable 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected <T extends NetworkSerializable>
      void      		 Server.ServerClient.onReceivedData(T data)
      Propagate the received data to the server.
      protected <T extends NetworkSerializable>
      void      		 Client.onReceivedData(T data)
      This method is triggered automatically when the client has received data from the server.
      protected <T extends NetworkSerializable>
      void      		 Server.onReceivedData(T data, Server.ServerClient sender)
      This method is triggered automatically when the server has received data from any client.
      <T extends NetworkSerializable>
      void      		 NetworkCommunication.sendData(T data)
      Writes the specified data into the connection's output stream, and flushes the stream.
      <T extends NetworkSerializable>
      void      		 Server.sendDataTo(T data, java.util.function.Predicate<Server.ServerClient> predicate)
      Sends the specified data object to the specified clients that are identified by the predicate.
      <T extends NetworkSerializable>
      void      		 Server.sendDataToAll(T data)
      Sends the specified data object to all connected clients.
      <T extends NetworkSerializable>
      void      		 Server.sendDataToSingle(T data, Server.ServerClient recipient)
      Sends the specified data object to the specified client.
      Methods in networking that return NetworkSerializable 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      NetworkSerializable NetworkCommunication.readData()
      Reads and returns an object from the connection's streams.
